irritated by these thoughts Prince Andrew went toward his room to write to his father, to whom he wrote every day. In the corridor he met Nesvftski, with whom he shared a room, and the wag Zherk6v; they were as usual laughing. 
"Why are you so glum?" asked Nesvitski no- ticing Prince Andrew's pale face and glittering eyes. 
"There's nothing to be gay about/' answered Bolk6nski.
